Stock Explain: Apple is a leading tech company known for its innovative products like the iPhone, Mac, and Apple Watch.
Google is a global technology company specializing in internet services like search, advertising, and cloud computing.
Microsoft is a multinational company that develops software, hardware, and services, including Windows OS and Azure.
Nvidia is a leader in graphics processing units (GPUs) for gaming, professional visualization, data centers, and automotive.
TSMC is the world’s largest independent semiconductor foundry, producing chips for various industries.
Intel designs and manufactures semiconductor chips, providing computing solutions for devices, servers, and more.
AMD produces computer processors and related technologies for servers, PCs, and gaming consoles.
Cisco provides networking and cybersecurity solutions for enterprises and service providers worldwide.
Oracle offers database software, cloud services, and enterprise software products.
Meta (formerly Facebook) is a social media and technology company that develops products for social networking and virtual reality.
Pfizer is a global pharmaceutical company known for its vaccines, cancer treatments, and other medical products.
Johnson & Johnson is a healthcare company that develops pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and consumer health products.
Merck is a global pharmaceutical company focused on developing innovative medicines, vaccines, and animal health products.
AbbVie is a biopharmaceutical company that develops drugs for immunology, oncology, and neuroscience.
Bristol Myers Squibb focuses on discovering and developing therapies for serious diseases, including cancer.
GlaxoSmithKline is a pharmaceutical company that develops vaccines, medicines, and consumer health products.
Eli Lilly is a global pharmaceutical company specializing in diabetes, cancer, and immunology treatments.
CVS Health operates a chain of pharmacies and provides healthcare services and insurance.
Amgen is a biotechnology company focused on developing therapies for serious illnesses, including cancer and cardiovascular diseases.
Medtronic is a global medical device company that provides innovative solutions for various medical conditions.
JPMorgan Chase is a global financial services firm offering investment banking, asset management, and financial services.
Bank of America is a multinational banking and financial services company offering banking, investing, and wealth management services.
Wells Fargo provides banking, investment, mortgage, and consumer finance services.
Citigroup is a global financial services company providing banking, investment, and wealth management services.
Goldman Sachs is an investment banking and financial services company offering services in investment management, securities, and more.
Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm providing investment banking, wealth management, and investment management services.
U.S. Bancorp is the parent company of U.S. Bank, offering financial services including banking, mortgages, and credit cards.
American Express is a multinational financial services company, best known for its charge cards, credit cards, and travel services.
Visa is a global payments technology company that facilitates digital payments and financial transactions across the world.
Mastercard is a global payments technology company offering electronic payment solutions, including credit and debit cards.
ExxonMobil is one of the largest publicly traded oil and gas companies, involved in exploration, production, refining, and marketing.
TotalEnergies is a multinational energy company engaged in oil and gas exploration, renewable energy, and sustainable solutions.
Chevron is a multinational corporation involved in the exploration, production, and marketing of oil, gas, and energy products.
BP is an integrated oil and gas company, providing energy products and services across the globe.
Schlumberger is a leading provider of technology and services for oil and gas exploration, production, and processing.
Enbridge is a North American energy infrastructure company focused on oil and gas transportation and renewable energy projects.
Pioneer Natural Resources is a major oil and gas exploration and production company focused on the Permian Basin.
ConocoPhillips is a global energy company involved in oil and natural gas exploration, production, and marketing.
Occidental Petroleum is an international oil and gas exploration and production company, also investing in carbon management and renewable energy.
Coca-Cola is a multinational beverage company best known for its soft drinks, including Coca-Cola, Diet Coke, and Fanta.
PepsiCo is a global food and beverage company, including products like Pepsi, Mountain Dew, Lay's, and Quaker Oats.
Procter & Gamble is a multinational consumer goods company that produces health, hygiene, and home care products.
Target is a retail chain offering a wide range of products, including groceries, clothing, and electronics.
Walmart is the world’s largest retailer, offering a wide range of products at affordable prices through its global network of stores and e-commerce platform.
Costco is a global warehouse retailer that offers bulk goods, groceries, and various other products at competitive prices.
McDonald's is a global fast-food restaurant chain known for its burgers, fries, and breakfast items.
The Walt Disney Company is a diversified entertainment conglomerate involved in movies, TV, theme parks, and media networks.
Starbucks is a global coffeehouse chain known for its premium coffee drinks, pastries, and beverages.
Colgate-Palmolive is a global consumer goods company that produces personal care, home care, and pet care products.
